docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 29 -- Anyone caught carrying on propaganda against the Argentine Government will be "inexorably" sent to concentration camps in cold and desolate Patagonia, according to a warning issued by the police yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 29 -- Anyone caught carrying on propaganda against the Argentine Government will be "inexorably" sent to concentration camps in cold and desolate Patagonia, according to a warning issued by the police yesterday.
docs.abstract: Govt demand that certain statements be published revealed by Buenos Aires Vanguardia

headline.main: ARGENTINA SENDS CRITICS TO CAMPS; Exile to Patagonia Is Promised for All Aiding Propaganda Against Government

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 -- Complaints made in New York yesterday by United States exporters -- particularly of oils and fats -- that markets in Egypt, the Near East and Africa were being reserved for their British competitors were answered today by...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 -- Complaints made in New York yesterday by United States exporters -- particularly of oils and fats -- that markets in Egypt, the Near East and Africa were being reserved for their British competitors were answered today by sources here close to the Combined Agency for Middle East Supply, which has jurisdiction in this matter.
docs.abstract: GB-US joint area agreement for certain purchases for Middle East Supply Corp revealed

headline.main: NEAR EAST IMPORTS BRING EXPLANATION; Efforts to Save Cargo Space Reason for Ban, Washington Sources Declare

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The explanation of the British-American division of markets for fats and oils issued in Washington on Wednesday by "sources close to the Combined Agency for Middle East Supplies," while "equivocal and misleading," is at least quasi-official and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The explanation of the British-American division of markets for fats and oils issued in Washington on Wednesday by "sources close to the Combined Agency for Middle East Supplies," while "equivocal and misleading," is at least quasi-official and serves to shed some additional light on the so-called "joint-area" trading agreements between the two Governments now in force, H.I. Malatzky, director of Himala International, declared yesterday.
docs.abstract: Wash sources explain license refusal for oil exports to Egypt; H I Malatzky comments

headline.main: U.S. OIL, FATS REPLY CALLED 'MISLEADING'; Held 'Equivocal' but at Least Quasi-Official, Shedding Some Light on Anglo-British Pact

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED DEC. 4, 1943
MORE ARGENTINE REFUGEES; Total in Uruguay Reaches 200 -- Underground Press Gains

docs.snippet: Whether a world bank is established or not, Latin-American exchange, with the exception of Argentina and Uruguay, will be tied closely to the dollar and New York will become the financial clearing house for Latin nations, John B. Glenn, president of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Whether a world bank is established or not, Latin-American exchange, with the exception of Argentina and Uruguay, will be tied closely to the dollar and New York will become the financial clearing house for Latin nations, John B. Glenn, president of Pan American Trust Company, declared last night.
docs.abstract: US-Latin Amer: J B Glenn on post-war outlook

headline.main: CITY SEEN AS CENTER OF AMERICAS' FINANCE; Exchange to Be Tied to Dollar -- Argentina, Uruguay Excepted

docs.snippet: Quantities of fresh raw furs now arriving in the market here are somewhat larger than anticipated. The increase in volume was attributed mainly to the higher prices being quoted trappers this season compared with the low levels of the two preceding...
docs.lead_paragraph: Quantities of fresh raw furs now arriving in the market here are somewhat larger than anticipated. The increase in volume was attributed mainly to the higher prices being quoted trappers this season compared with the low levels of the two preceding seasons.

headline.main: BRAZILIAN APPOINTED; Chief of Staff to Head Delegation for Continental Defense

byline.original: By Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Trade and other business transactions between New York and Latin-American countries are being endangered through over-long delays in air mail transit, even with allowances made for wartime conditions, it was indicated in a survey by the Foreign Trade...
docs.lead_paragraph: Trade and other business transactions between New York and Latin-American countries are being endangered through over-long delays in air mail transit, even with allowances made for wartime conditions, it was indicated in a survey by the Foreign Trade Bureau of the Commerce and Industry Association of New York, released yesterday.

headline.main: DELAYS IN AIR MAIL LAID TO CENSORSHIP; Put at 3 to 33 Days in Some Instances in Survey Made by Commerce Group
